page.title: 07RYEISH GREEN SCHOOL (PART 1)
page.content: THE SCHOOL IS PLEASANTLY SITUATED IN OPEN COUNTRYSIDE WITHIN A MILE OF THE READING BOUNDARY AND THE M4 EXIT.THE HAMLET OF RYEISH GREEN IS IN THE PARISH OF SHINFIELD AND LIES BETWEEN SHINFIELD AND SPENCERS WOOD.THE CATCHMENT AREA OF THE SCHOOL INCLUDES SHINFIELD,SPENCERS WOOD,PART OF LOWER EARLEY,GRAZELEY,RISELEY,BEECH HILL, SWALLOWFIELD AND FARLEY HILL.PUPILS FROM OTHER AREAS ATTEND THE SCHOOL BY SPECIAL ARRANGEMENT. THE SCHOOL IS A COUNTY,SIX-FORM ENTRY, CO-EDUCATIONAL,DAY SECONDARY COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL AND IS HOUSED IN MODERN BUILDINGS WHICH HAVE BEEN ADDED TO A SMALL VILLAGE SCHOOL.RECENT DEVELOPMENT PROVIDES THE SCHOOL WITH EXTENSIVE PLAYING FIELDS AND RECREATIONAL AREAS.
